result.execSummary:
The defendant Raymond S Mickley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If the stayed portion of the sentence is imposed and there are outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall provide current financial information to the court.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Must report to probation by 4:00 PM on April 14, 2015.

miscConds.notes:
Attorney Fees To Be Determined.  Probation does NOT collect attorney fees.
If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Must have no abusive contact with Angela M
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.

Defendant Raymond S Mickley in court with attorney Laura Ann Sutton.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. THIS COVERS 14CF402 AND 14CF377.

14CF377: Defendant pleads guilty to Count 2. 
14CF402: State moves to amend to misdemeanor bail jumping. Defendant pleads guilty to amended charge of misdemeanor bail jumping - 946.49(1)(a)

Any other charges - DRI.

State makes recommendation. Defense makes recommendation. 

Court relates and orders: 
90 days jail - concurrent - STAYED.
3 days jail credit if revoked.
1 yr Probation - concurrent - IMPOSED. Defendant to report to Probation by 4:00 p.m. tomorrow, April 14, 2015.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
Court costs including DNA surcharge
Must have no abusive contact with Angela M.
Bond to be applied towards costs.
Plea hearing on May 11, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
